message.content:
cs.NI, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.SY. 

This paper focuses on the edge caching problem in fog radio access networks, which is a subfield of networked systems and technologies. Therefore, cs.NI (networking and internet architecture) is the most likely category. The paper also proposes online content popularity prediction and offline user preference learning algorithms, which involve machine learning techniques such as online gradient descent and follow the (proximally) regularized leader. Hence, cs.LG (machine learning) and cs.DS (data structures and algorithms) are also likely categories. The paper also considers content popularity from the perspective of regional users, which involves information theory and communication theory, making cs.IT (information theory) a possible category. Finally, the paper proposes a learning-based edge caching architecture, which involves control theory and optimization, making cs.SY (systems and control) a possible category as well.
